name: src/Entity.js
src/Module.js
src/ObservableSet.js
ObservableSet
description:
A data-structure with the same interface as `Set`,
and emits mutation events from rxjs streams.

params.name: initialContent
params.description: initial elements to put in this set object

name: e
description: Get an event stream associated with this set object.

params.name: op
params.description: the name of the event stream you want: `"add"` or `"delete"`

name: p
description: Get an event stream associated with this set object.

unknown.tagValue: {Observable} - the rxjs event stream (based on the `BehaviorSubject` class)

params.name: name
params.description:
the name of the property you want; the
                        only one available at the moment is `"value"`

return.description: the rxjs event stream (based on the `BehaviorSubject` class)

name: add
description: Add a new element with the given value to this set object.

params.name: val
params.description: the value to add to the set

name: clear
description: Remove all elements from this set object.

name: delete
description: Removes the element with the value and returns the value that `has(val)` would have previously returned.

unknown.tagValue: {boolean} - the element that was removed, if it existed; `false` otherwise

return.description: the element that was removed, if it existed; `false` otherwise

unknown.tagValue:
{Iterator<T[]>} - a new Iterator object that yields an array of
                             `[value, value]` for each element in this set object.

return.description:
a new Iterator object that yields an array of
                             `[value, value]` for each element in this set object.

name: forEach
description: Run a function for each element in this set object.

params.name: callbackFn
params.description: the function to invoke for each element

params.name: thisArg
params.description: the object that will be `this` inside the `callbackFn`

name: has
description: Test whether this set object contains a certain value.

unknown.tagValue: {boolean} `true`, if `val` is an element in this set object; `false` otherwise

return.description: `true`, if `val` is an element in this set object; `false` otherwise

unknown.tagValue: {Iterator<T>} - a new Iterator object that contains the values for each element in this set object

return.description: a new Iterator object that contains the values for each element in this set object

name: [Symbol.iterator]
description: The presence of this method makes an observable set object iterable through `for...of` loops.

unknown.tagValue: {Iterator<T>} - a new Iterator object that contains the values for each element in this set object

return.description: a new Iterator object that contains the values for each element in this set object

unknown.tagValue: {number} - the number of values in this set object

return.description: the number of values in this set object

name: overwrite
description:
Overwrite the content of this set object,
emitting the proper `delete` and `add` signals (in that order).

params.name: newContent
params.description: the new elements of the set

name: src/TypedModule.js
TypedModule
description:
Typed Modules allow to more easily create related
Type, Template and HasType classes. For example,
to create LyphType and LyphTemplate resources and
their HasType relationship from one description.

parseCardinality
description: Transform a string representation of a cardinality range into an object.

unknown.tagValue: {{min: number, max: number}} an object with `min` and `max` fields

params.name: cardinality
params.description:
{string} a string representation of minimum and maximum cardinality `"min..max"`,
                    where `min` is a natural number and `max` is a natural number greater or
                    equal to `min` or an asterisk symbol `*` to represent an unbounded maximum

name: stringifyCardinality
description: Transform an object representation of a cardinality range into a representative string.

unknown.tagValue: {string} a string representing the given cardinality range, possibly collapsed if `min === max` and `abbreviate === true`

params.name: cardinality
params.description: {{min: number, max: number}} an object representation of minimum and maximum cardinality `{min, max}`

params.name: abbreviate
params.description: {boolean} whether or not to collapse the resulting string if `min === max`

return.description: a string representing the given cardinality range, possibly collapsed if `min === max` and `abbreviate === true`

unknown.tagValue: {boolean} `true`, if both sets have the same elements; `false`, otherwise

return.description: `true`, if both sets have the same elements; `false`, otherwise

name: constraint
description:
Express an assertion that's tied to outside input.
We may later replace this with a more sophisticated mechanism.

params.name: message
params.description: the message to display if the condition fails
